website_summaries.verdict: The Brooks Bedlam 2 is a stability running shoe designed to support individuals who overpronate. It is built with a support system that helps protect the knee and control excessive movements. This shoe also features energizing midsole and outsole technologies, which aim to enhance speed and comfort. It is suitable for running and casual walks.
pros: The Brooks Bedlam 2 is comfortable, according to many runners
A user, with flat feet, noted that it is suitable for athletic purposes
Some buyers appreciated the flexible upper of the shoe
Several consumers said that the shoe is responsive
The tongue helps offer a snugger fit, some wearers claimed
One consumer mentioned that it offers good arch support
Many runners appreciated the performance of GuideRails® technology
cons: Some buyers complained because the plastic ankle support is hurting their ankles
The upper material tends to rub against the foot causing discomfort, some users reported
This version is tighter compared to its predecessor, said some runners

customer_reviews.title: Brooks is the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Brooks and the best one so far. I took Brooks online questionnaire to find the fit and shoe I was looking for and I am very happy with this pair. High quality and great foot support when running.
customer_reviews.author: Boozer

customer_reviews.title: Not like the Ghost at all...
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was well made, but almost forced me to change my natural running style. They felt very heavy and hurt my feet. I ran half a mile in them and walked back barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Baird

customer_reviews.title: Wears out too quickly
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoe but the heels and soles are excessively worn after only 2 months. I purchased these shoes on 04/04/20 and started wearing them running on 04/13. I run an average of 3 miles a day, 5 days each week. That's around 141 miles and the heel is worn to the cushion. Although I like the shoe, I expect a bit more out of a running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond L. Baum Jr.
